FMA

Class FMASimulator

  • java.lang.Object
    • FSA.Simulator
      • FMA.FMASimulator

  • public class FMASimulator
extends Simulator
    Extends Simulator by adding the registers and change the condition of validity of transitions, and override various methods.
    Author:
    Davide Basile

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class FSA.Simulator

        automa, pointer_state, pointer_string

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FMASimulator(FSA automa) 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void changeAutoma(FSA automa)
      Change the automaton
      protected Continuation createContinuation()
      Create a new Continuation with the freezed state of the automaton
      protected boolean isValid(Transition tr, int symbol)
      A transition tr is valid if the symbol is contained in the registers and the label is equal to the index of the register containing the symbol in input; or if the symbol in input is not contained in the registers and the label is equal to the fuction rho in the actual state.
      protected void restoreStateContinuation(Continuation c)
      restore the state of the simulator with the parameters in the continuation C.
      protected void updateState(Transition tr, int symbol)
      Update the register of the automaton if the symbol in input is not contained in the register, invoke the method of the superclass for updating the other parameters.

    • Method Detail

      • changeAutoma

        public void changeAutoma(FSA automa)
        Change the automaton
        Overrides:
        changeAutoma in class Simulator

      • isValid

        protected boolean isValid(Transition tr,
              int symbol)
        A transition tr is valid if the symbol is contained in the registers and the label is equal to the index of the register containing the symbol in input; or if the symbol in input is not contained in the registers and the label is equal to the fuction rho in the actual state.
        Overrides:
        isValid in class Simulator
        Parameters:
        tr - transition to be performed
        symbol - symbol in input
        Returns:
        true if the transition is valid

      • updateState

        protected void updateState(Transition tr,
               int symbol)
        Update the register of the automaton if the symbol in input is not contained in the register, invoke the method of the superclass for updating the other parameters.
        Overrides:
        updateState in class Simulator
        Parameters:
        tr - the transition to be performed
        symbol - the symbol in input

      • restoreStateContinuation

        protected void restoreStateContinuation(Continuation c)
        restore the state of the simulator with the parameters in the continuation C. First invoke the method of the super class and then update the register of the automaton with a copy of the register stored in the continuation.
        Overrides:
        restoreStateContinuation in class Simulator
        Parameters:
        c - the continuation to be restored

      • createContinuation

        protected Continuation createContinuation()
        Create a new Continuation with the freezed state of the automaton
        Overrides:
        createContinuation in class Simulator
        Returns:
        a new Continuation with the actual state of the simulator freezed
